title: Purpose and objectives
body_md:
This policy sets out how {{firm.name}} supports speaking up and whistleblowing in line with FCA expectations and SYSC requirements.

Objectives:
- encourage early reporting of wrongdoing.
- protect confidentiality and prevent retaliation.
- define clear channels, triage, and investigation steps.
- maintain records and management information.

title: Scope and applicability
body_md: This policy applies to all staff, contractors, and appointed representatives. It covers concerns about regulatory breaches, financial crime, misconduct, control failures, and other wrongdoing that could harm customers, markets, or the firm.

title: What is whistleblowing
body_md:
A protected disclosure is information that the reporter reasonably believes shows wrongdoing, such as regulatory breaches, criminal offences, data breaches, or cover-ups.

Personal grievances (pay, workload) are usually handled through HR channels, but should still be raised if they reveal wider misconduct.

title: Channels and confidentiality
What to include
body_md:
Reports should include factual details such as who, what, when, where, and how, plus any evidence available. Avoid rumours or opinions without context.

If unsure, report what you observed and allow the investigation process to assess further.

title: Triage and investigation
body_md:
All reports are triaged based on urgency and risk. Investigators are assigned, evidence is gathered securely, and outcomes are documented.

Feedback is provided to the reporter where appropriate and lawful.

title: Manager responsibilities
body_md:
Managers must listen without judgement, protect confidentiality, record facts, and escalate immediately via the whistleblowing process.

Managers must also prevent retaliation and support the reporter throughout the process.

title: No retaliation
body_md:
Retaliation against anyone who speaks up is prohibited. Examples include bullying, demotion, exclusion, or unjustified changes to pay or shifts.

Any suspected retaliation must be reported immediately.

title: Escalation and regulators
Records and MI
Training and awareness
body_md: All staff must complete whistleblowing training. Managers receive additional training on how to receive and escalate concerns. Training completion is recorded and refreshed as required.

title: Governance and review
body_md: The Whistleblowing Champion and Compliance oversee this policy. The board receives periodic MI on whistleblowing themes, investigation timeliness, and remediation outcomes.
